titles.title: A bill to quiet title and possession with respect to a certain private land claim in Sumter County, Alabama.

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources.
Referred to Subcommittee on Public Lands, National Parks.
Committee on Energy and Natural Resources requested executive comment from Interior Department, OMB.
Subcommittee on Public Lands, National Parks. Hearings held.

calendar.text: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources. Ordered to be reported with an amendment favorably.

action.text: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources. Reported to Senate by Senator Johnston with an amendment. With written report No. 100-530.

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 965.

action.text: Senate passed companion measure H.R. 5059 in lieu of this measure by Voice Vote.
Indefinitely postponed by Senate by Unanimous Consent.

committee.subcommittee: Public Lands, National Parks and Forests
committee.name: Senate Energy and Natural Resources

bill.summary: 10/11/1988--Indefinitely postponed in Senate. (Measure indefinitely postponed in Senate (See H.R. 5059 as passed Senate for similar provisions)) Waives the 160-acre limitation on conveyances under the Color-of-Title Act for any claim for a patent that may be filed under such Act for a specified parcel of land in Sumter County, Alabama.
